intro: [WRONG START] Tecomanthe aurantiica, commonly known as the orange-flowered climbing plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its vibrant orange flowers that bloom throughout the warmer months. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dark seeds. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Tecomanthe aurantiica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with ample sunlight.
